title: Apostasy in Islam
summary: Apostasy in Islam (Arabic: ردة‎, riddah or ارتداد, irtidād, an apostate from Islam is a murtad (Arabic: مرتد‎)) is commonly defined as the abandonment of Islam by a Muslim, in thought, word, or through deed.[1][2][3][4][5] It includes not only  explicit renunciations of the Islamic faith by converting to another religion[1] (or abandoning religion altogether),[1][6][7] but also blasphemy or heresy,[8][9] through any action or utterance implying unbelief, including those denying a "fundamental tenet or creed" of Islam.[10]
